# init(_:selection:content:)

**Initializer**

Creates a picker that generates its label from a localized string key.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated init(_ titleKey: LocalizedStringKey, selection: Binding<SelectionValue>, @ViewBuilder content: () -> Content)
```

## Parameters

- **titleKey**: A localized string key that describes the purpose of selecting an option.
- **selection**: A binding to a property that determines the currently-selected option.
- **content**: A view that contains the set of options.

## Discussion

This initializer creates a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] view on your behalf, and treats the localized key similar to [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text/init(_:tableName:bundle:comment:)]. See [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] for more information about localizing strings.

## Creating a picker

- **init(selection:content:label:)**: Creates a picker that displays a custom label.
